laboratory_examinations.findings: Liposarcoma with a heterogeneous appearance, some portions appearing myxoid and others pleomorphic, of intermediate grade (G2). Surgical margins were clear.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Recurring nodule developed 2 months later; another anterior orbitotomy and excision revealed a myxoid liposarcoma, again G2. Second recurrence occurred 2 months later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Pleomorphic liposarcoma with marked cellular atypia and muscle infiltration.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Five years later, mild ipsilateral proptosis developed; imaging confirmed recurrence with residual macroscopic disease.
Recurring tumor 11 months later revealed low-grade liposarcoma; subsequent recurrence 6 months later showed intermediate-grade liposarcoma.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Well-differentiated liposarcoma, with positive S-100 immunohistochemical staining.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No recurrence at last follow-up 2.5 years later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Myxoid liposarcoma with evidence of lipoblasts in a mucinous matrix.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Recurrence noted 4 months later with increasing proptosis.
Received exenteration and local radiotherapy but did not attend for follow-up.
